title: Matt’s Dry Rub
instructions: In a small bowl, combine all the ingredients.
remarks: This dry rub keeps indefinitely in the refrigerator. Apply the rub when it’s at room temperature.  For a brisket, rub two-thirds of the mixture on the “fat” side and the other third on the “bottom” before grilling.  For chicken or ribs, simply rub on while grilling. Yield:  Make enough for a 4 to 5 pound brisket. Source:  Matt Martinez’s Culinary Frontier:  A Real Texas Cookbook, by Matt Martinez, Jr., and Steve Pate, published by Doubleday, 1540 Broadway, New York, N.Y. 10036, © 1997 by Matt Martinez, Jr., and Steve Pate.
